arts.ttl: Liverpool star provides positive injury update after early Crystal Palace substitution
arts.sum: Liverpool midfielder Alexis Mac Allister eases fears about a possible injury concern following his early substitution against Crystal Palace.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace 0-1 Liverpool: Player ratings as Reds continue dominant Premier League start
arts.sum: Their first real chance of the game arrived just before half-time as Ismaila Sarr came close to marking his first Palace start with a goal. As the clock continued, Liverpool's counter press seemed too tough for Palace to compete with, as the hosts struggled to keep the ball long enough to generate any attacking play.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner delivers verdict on Chelsea loanee’s Crystal Palace debut in Liverpool defeat
arts.sum: The Chelsea loanee, who joined on deadline day, was making his debut against Arne Slot’s side after being named in the matchday squad for the first time against Everton last week. I don’t know the last time he played over 85 minutes.

arts.ttl: Young Liverpool fan makes cheeky Mo Salah request during Crystal Palace win
arts.sum: A Liverpool fan hoping to get Mohamed Salah's autograph during their 1-0 victory against Crystal Palace cheekily asked Joe Cole, who was working as a pundit for TNT Sports, to get it for them

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace boss responds to Premier League statement on controversial Liverpool decision
arts.sum: Liverpool claimed all three points at Selhurst Park with a 1-0 win over Crystal Palace thanks to Diogo Jota's early goal, but the Eagles weren't happy with the decision not to award a second-half penalty

Oliver Glasner says his Crystal Palace players will respond to their difficult run of results through hard work, as he drew confidence from an improved second-half performance that almost earned the Eagles a draw against Liverpool.

arts.ttl: Joe Cole says Crystal Palace were denied a 'nailed-on penalty' against Liverpool even though VAR claimed Virgil van Dijk's grab on Marc Guehi 'had no impact on the play'
arts.sum: Ex-Liverpool star Cole believes that his former side were lucky not to give away a penalty kick during Saturday's 1-0 win at Crystal Palace. He said: 'I think they have got away with one there.'

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace defender Daniel Munoz set for scan after suffering injury in Liverpool clash
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner has confirmed that Daniel Munoz will have a scan on Sunday after the Crystal Palace wing-back suffered a groin adductor injury in the 1-0 defeat to Liverpool on Saturday. Nathaniel Clyne came on after 16 minutes and filled in at right wing-back.

arts.ttl: Eddie Nketiah reveals reason he left Arsenal in summer transfer window
arts.sum: Eddie Nketiah has explained why he left boyhood club Arsenal during the summer transfer window, admitting that he needed to leave in order to get more minutes. Speaking to the Independent about his decision to move in the transfer window, Nketiah admitted that it was the need for more game time that led to him leaving Arsenal:

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner takes solace from Crystal Palace’s second-half performance in Liverpool defeat
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner says he will take confidence from Crystal Palace’s second-half performance in their 1-0 defeat to Liverpool at Selhurst Park on Saturday. Glasner’s side thought they took the lead after 30 seconds when Ismaila Sarr crossed along the face of goal for Eddie Nketiah to score, but the former Arsenal striker had his first Premier League goal since signing in the summer ruled out for outside.
